intro: Azorellopsis, commonly known as the Azorean rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Azores. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often spiny stems and small, showy flowers. The plants are typically found in rocky or coastal habitats, where they have adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Azorellopsis species are known for their ability to thrive in poor soil and high sunlight exposure. Their unique morphology and ecological adaptations make them an important part of the Azorean flora.
